001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.drivers.base;
002
003import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
004import org.openqa.selenium.remote.AbstractDriverOptions;
005
006/**
007 * Defines a contract for WebDriver providers responsible for managing browser-specific configurations and instances.
008 *
009 * <p>Implementations of this interface should provide methods to:
010 * <ul>
011 *     <li>Create browser-specific {@link AbstractDriverOptions}.</li>
012 *     <li>Apply default and headless arguments to WebDriver options.</li>
013 *     <li>Handle driver setup and download logic.</li>
014 *     <li>Instantiate WebDriver instances with configured options.</li>
015 * </ul>
016 *
017 * <p>The generic type {@code T} represents a browser-specific configuration that extends {@link AbstractDriverOptions}.
018 * Implementations must define the specific WebDriver options required for a particular browser.
019 *
020 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
021 */
022public interface DriverProvider<T extends AbstractDriverOptions<?>> {
023
024   /**
025    * Creates a new instance of browser-specific driver options.
026    *
027    * <p>This method should return an instance of the browser options configured with necessary defaults.
028    *
029    * @return A {@link AbstractDriverOptions} instance containing browser-specific configurations.
030    */
031   T createOptions();
032
033   /**
034    * Creates and returns a new WebDriver instance using the provided options.
035    *
036    * <p>This method initializes a new WebDriver based on the configured browser options and settings.
037    *
038    * @param options The browser-specific driver options.
039    * @return A configured instance of {@link WebDriver}.
040    */
041   WebDriver createDriver(T options);
042
043   /**
044    * Applies default arguments to the provided driver options.
045    *
046    * <p>This method configures default settings such as window size, timeouts, and other browser-specific capabilities.
047    *
048    * @param options The driver options to which default arguments should be applied.
049    */
050   void applyDefaultArguments(T options);
051
052   /**
053    * Applies headless mode arguments to the provided driver options.
054    *
055    * <p>This method ensures the WebDriver runs in headless mode if required.
056    *
057    * @param options The driver options to modify for headless execution.
058    */
059   void applyHeadlessArguments(T options);
060
061   /**
062    * Sets up the WebDriver by downloading the necessary binary if it has not already been downloaded.
063    *
064    * <p>Implementations should ensure that the correct WebDriver version is downloaded and ready for execution.
065    *
066    * @param version The version of the WebDriver to download.
067    */
068   void setupDriver(String version);
069
070   /**
071    * Downloads the WebDriver binary for the specified version.
072    *
073    * <p>This method should contain logic for fetching and installing the WebDriver for a given browser.
074    *
075    * @param version The WebDriver version to download.
076    */
077   void downloadDriver(String version);
078
079}
